frameDefinitions: A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.
An Agent begins preventing a Captive from moving despite a tendency or desire on the part of the Captive to do so.
An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge which induces the rapid motion of the Projectile.
The Authorities hold a Suspect under suspicion of having committed a crime (Charges).
An Agent disables a flying or floating Patient, causing it to be unable to support itself in its current medium.
An Authority excuses an Offense that an Offender has committed, with the effect of ending or preventing any punishment.
frameExamples: Authorities recently <t>captured</t> several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
The bank robber <t>shot</t> at the clerks with an AK-47.
The police <t>held</t> Mr. Smith in the slammer on charges of killing his lawyer.
It's rumored that she <t>downed</t> a helicopter with a precisely fired arrow.
President Ford <t>pardoned</t> her after it came to light she was being held in Japan as an 'enemy alien' and was secretly working to subvert the broadcasts DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.
An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The method or action that the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> performs resulting in the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The device used by the <fen>Killer</fen> to bring about the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The point or period of time within which the <fen>Victim</fen> is killed.
The location where the death took place.
The entity which is captured.
The <fen>Agent</fen> brings the <fen>Captive</fen> into custody.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Captive</fen>.
When the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The entity whose rapid, dangerous motion is caused by the Agent and/or Firearm.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act causing the motion of the Projectile.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the shooting event takes place.
The location in which the shooting event takes place.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> hold the <fen>Suspect</fen> in custody.
This role identifies the person who is taken into custody and held, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
When the detaining occurs.
Where the detaining takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> forces the <fen>Patient</fen> to come to the ground.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that is being forced to the ground.
An event which causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to come to the ground.
The time at which the event takes place.
The location at which the event takes place.
This role denotes the offender that seeks or gets the pardon.
Authority is the organization or person taht grants the pardon.
This role denotes the the illegal act that the <fen>Offender</fen> is pardoned for.
This role denotes the time when the pardon is given
The location at which the pardoning takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The rockslide</fex> killed nearly half of the climbers.
The flood exterminated the rats <fex>by cutting off access to food</fex>.
It's difficult to suicide <fex>with only a pocketknife</fex>.
There is no evidence that the royal family was killed <fex>during the destruction</fex> at this site.
Apparently there were two murders <fex>in Atherton</fex> in one week.
Police have captured <fex>three of the suspected bombers</fex> after a week-long search.
<fex>Authorities</fex> recently captured several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
Authorities secured the target <fex>in a private residence</fex>.
The robbers shot at the clerks <fex>as they ran out of the bank</fex>
The bankrobbers were crazy enough to shoot at the clerks with an AK-47 <fex>inside the bank</fex>
Defense minister Ivanov rules out pardon <fex>for Chechen rebel leader Maskhadov</fex>.
<fex>The governement</fex> issued a pardon to the two convicts.
They demanded a pardon to John <fex>for inadverdent manslaughter</fex>.
The families demanded a <fex>posthumous</fex> pardon for the executed soldiers.

On 1 March 2002, Andreyev was found guilty of libel and conditionally sentenced
to two years in prison and then pardoned <fex>in the courtroom</fex>.
